nodes.label: General Data Protection Regulation
Chapter I: General provisions
Article 1: Subject-matter and objectives
Point 1: This Regulation lays down rules relating to the protection o

attrs.text: This Regulation lays down rules relating to the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and rules relating to the free movement of personal data.

nodes.label: Point 2: This Regulation protects fundamental rights and freedoms of

attrs.text: This Regulation protects fundamental rights and freedoms of natural persons and in particular their right to the protection of personal data.

nodes.label: Point 3: The free movement of personal data within the Union shall be

attrs.text: The free movement of personal data within the Union shall be neither restricted nor prohibited for reasons connected with the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data.

nodes.label: Article 2: Material scope
Point 1: This Regulation applies to the processing of personal data w

attrs.text: This Regulation applies to the processing of personal data wholly or partly by automated means and to the processing other than by automated means of personal data which form part of a filing system or are intended to form part of a filing system.

nodes.label: Point 2: This Regulation does not apply to the processing of personal

attrs.text: This Regulation does not apply to the processing of personal data:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: in the course of an activity which falls outside the scope o

attrs.text: in the course of an activity which falls outside the scope of Union law;

nodes.label: Subpoint b: by the Member States when carrying out activities which fall

attrs.text: by the Member States when carrying out activities which fall within the scope of Chapter 2 of Title V of the TEU;

nodes.label: Subpoint c: by a natural person in the course of a purely personal or ho

attrs.text: by a natural person in the course of a purely personal or household activity;

nodes.label: Subpoint d: by competent authorities for the purposes of the prevention,

attrs.text: by competent authorities for the purposes of the prevention, investigation, detection or prosecution of criminal offences or the execution of criminal penalties, including the safeguarding against and the prevention of threats to public security.

nodes.label: Point 3: For the processing of personal data by the Union institution

attrs.text: For the processing of personal data by the Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies, Regulation (EC) No 45/2001 applies. Regulation (EC) No 45/2001 and other Union legal acts applicable to such processing of personal data shall be adapted to the principles and rules of this Regulation in accordance with Article 98.

nodes.label: Point 4: This Regulation shall be without prejudice to the applicatio

attrs.text: This Regulation shall be without prejudice to the application of Directive 2000/31/EC, in particular of the liability rules of intermediary service providers in Articles 12 to 15 of that Directive.

nodes.label: Article 3: Territorial scope
Point 1: This Regulation applies to the processing of personal data i

attrs.text: This Regulation applies to the processing of personal data in the context of the activities of an establishment of a controller or a processor in the Union, regardless of whether the processing takes place in the Union or not.

nodes.label: Point 2: This Regulation applies to the processing of personal data o

attrs.text: This Regulation applies to the processing of personal data of data subjects who are in the Union by a controller or processor not established in the Union, where the processing activities are related to:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: the offering of goods or services, irrespective of whether a

attrs.text: the offering of goods or services, irrespective of whether a payment of the data subject is required, to such data subjects in the Union; or

nodes.label: Subpoint b: the monitoring of their behaviour as far as their behaviour

attrs.text: the monitoring of their behaviour as far as their behaviour takes place within the Union.

nodes.label: Point 3: This Regulation applies to the processing of personal data b

attrs.text: This Regulation applies to the processing of personal data by a controller not established in the Union, but in a place where Member State law applies by virtue of public international law.

nodes.label: Article 4: Definitions
Text: For the purposes of this Regulation:

attrs.text: For the purposes of this Regulation:

nodes.label: Point 1: ‘personal data’ means any information relating to an identif

attrs.text: ‘personal data’ means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person (‘data subject’); an identifiable natural person is one who can be identified, directly or indirectly, in particular by reference to an identifier such as a name, an identification number, location data, an online identifier or to one or more factors specific to the physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural or social identity of that natural person;

nodes.label: Point 2: ‘processing’ means any operation or set of operations which

attrs.text: ‘processing’ means any operation or set of operations which is performed on personal data or on sets of personal data, whether or not by automated means, such as collection, recording, organisation, structuring, storage, adaptation or alteration, retrieval, consultation, use, disclosure by transmission, dissemination or otherwise making available, alignment or combination, restriction, erasure or destruction;

nodes.label: Point 3: ‘restriction of processing’ means the marking of stored pers

attrs.text: ‘restriction of processing’ means the marking of stored personal data with the aim of limiting their processing in the future;

nodes.label: Point 4: ‘profiling’ means any form of automated processing of person

attrs.text: ‘profiling’ means any form of automated processing of personal data consisting of the use of personal data to evaluate certain personal aspects relating to a natural person, in particular to analyse or predict aspects concerning that natural person's performance at work, economic situation, health, personal preferences, interests, reliability, behaviour, location or movements;

nodes.label: Point 5: ‘pseudonymisation’ means the processing of personal data in

attrs.text: ‘pseudonymisation’ means the processing of personal data in such a manner that the personal data can no longer be attributed to a specific data subject without the use of additional information, provided that such additional information is kept separately and is subject to technical and organisational measures to ensure that the personal data are not attributed to an identified or identifiable natural person;

nodes.label: Point 6: ‘filing system’ means any structured set of personal data wh

attrs.text: ‘filing system’ means any structured set of personal data which are accessible according to specific criteria, whether centralised, decentralised or dispersed on a functional or geographical basis;

nodes.label: Point 7: ‘controller’ means the natural or legal person, public autho

attrs.text: ‘controller’ means the natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which, alone or jointly with others, determines the purposes and means of the processing of personal data; where the purposes and means of such processing are determined by Union or Member State law, the controller or the specific criteria for its nomination may be provided for by Union or Member State law;

nodes.label: Point 8: ‘processor’ means a natural or legal person, public authorit

attrs.text: ‘processor’ means a natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which processes personal data on behalf of the controller;

nodes.label: Point 9: ‘recipient’ means a natural or legal person, public authorit

attrs.text: ‘recipient’ means a natural or legal person, public authority, agency or another body, to which the personal data are disclosed, whether a third party or not. However, public authorities which may receive personal data in the framework of a particular inquiry in accordance with Union or Member State law shall not be regarded as recipients; the processing of those data by those public authorities shall be in compliance with the applicable data protection rules according to the purposes of the processing;

nodes.label: Point 10: ‘third party’ means a natural or legal person, public author

attrs.text: ‘third party’ means a natural or legal person, public authority, agency or body other than the data subject, controller, processor and persons who, under the direct authority of the controller or processor, are authorised to process personal data;

nodes.label: Point 11: ‘consent’ of the data subject means any freely given, specif

attrs.text: ‘consent’ of the data subject means any freely given, specific, informed and unambiguous indication of the data subject's wishes by which he or she, by a statement or by a clear affirmative action, signifies agreement to the processing of personal data relating to him or her;

nodes.label: Point 12: ‘personal data breach’ means a breach of security leading to

attrs.text: ‘personal data breach’ means a breach of security leading to the accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorised disclosure of, or access to, personal data transmitted, stored or otherwise processed;

nodes.label: Point 13: ‘genetic data’ means personal data relating to the inherited

attrs.text: ‘genetic data’ means personal data relating to the inherited or acquired genetic characteristics of a natural person which give unique information about the physiology or the health of that natural person and which result, in particular, from an analysis of a biological sample from the natural person in question;

nodes.label: Point 14: ‘biometric data’ means personal data resulting from specific

attrs.text: ‘biometric data’ means personal data resulting from specific technical processing relating to the physical, physiological or behavioural characteristics of a natural person, which allow or confirm the unique identification of that natural person, such as facial images or dactyloscopic data;

nodes.label: Point 15: ‘data concerning health’ means personal data related to the

attrs.text: ‘data concerning health’ means personal data related to the physical or mental health of a natural person, including the provision of health care services, which reveal information about his or her health status;

nodes.label: Point 16: ‘main establishment’ means:

attrs.text: ‘main establishment’ means:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: as regards a controller with establishments in more than one

attrs.text: as regards a controller with establishments in more than one Member State, the place of its central administration in the Union, unless the decisions on the purposes and means of the processing of personal data are taken in another establishment of the controller in the Union and the latter establishment has the power to have such decisions implemented, in which case the establishment having taken such decisions is to be considered to be the main establishment;

nodes.label: Subpoint b: as regards a processor with establishments in more than one

attrs.text: as regards a processor with establishments in more than one Member State, the place of its central administration in the Union, or, if the processor has no central administration in the Union, the establishment of the processor in the Union where the main processing activities in the context of the activities of an establishment of the processor take place to the extent that the processor is subject to specific obligations under this Regulation;

nodes.label: Point 17: ‘representative’ means a natural or legal person established

attrs.text: ‘representative’ means a natural or legal person established in the Union who, designated by the controller or processor in writing pursuant to Article 27, represents the controller or processor with regard to their respective obligations under this Regulation;

nodes.label: Point 18: ‘enterprise’ means a natural or legal person engaged in an e

attrs.text: ‘enterprise’ means a natural or legal person engaged in an economic activity, irrespective of its legal form, including partnerships or associations regularly engaged in an economic activity;

nodes.label: Point 19: ‘group of undertakings’ means a controlling undertaking and

attrs.text: ‘group of undertakings’ means a controlling undertaking and its controlled undertakings;

nodes.label: Point 20: ‘binding corporate rules’ means personal data protection pol

attrs.text: ‘binding corporate rules’ means personal data protection policies which are adhered to by a controller or processor established on the territory of a Member State for transfers or a set of transfers of personal data to a controller or processor in one or more third countries within a group of undertakings, or group of enterprises engaged in a joint economic activity;

nodes.label: Point 21: ‘supervisory authority’ means an independent public authorit

attrs.text: ‘supervisory authority’ means an independent public authority which is established by a Member State pursuant to Article 51;

nodes.label: Point 22: ‘supervisory authority concerned’ means a supervisory author

attrs.text: ‘supervisory authority concerned’ means a supervisory authority which is concerned by the processing of personal data because:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: the controller or processor is established on the territory

attrs.text: the controller or processor is established on the territory of the Member State of that supervisory authority;

nodes.label: Subpoint b: data subjects residing in the Member State of that superviso

attrs.text: data subjects residing in the Member State of that supervisory authority are substantially affected or likely to be substantially affected by the processing; or

nodes.label: Subpoint c: a complaint has been lodged with that supervisory authority;

attrs.text: a complaint has been lodged with that supervisory authority;

nodes.label: Point 23: ‘cross-border processing’ means either:

attrs.text: ‘cross-border processing’ means either:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: processing of personal data which takes place in the context

attrs.text: processing of personal data which takes place in the context of the activities of establishments in more than one Member State of a controller or processor in the Union where the controller or processor is established in more than one Member State; or

nodes.label: Subpoint b: processing of personal data which takes place in the context

attrs.text: processing of personal data which takes place in the context of the activities of a single establishment of a controller or processor in the Union but which substantially affects or is likely to substantially affect data subjects in more than one Member State.

nodes.label: Point 24: ‘relevant and reasoned objection’ means an objection to a dr

attrs.text: ‘relevant and reasoned objection’ means an objection to a draft decision as to whether there is an infringement of this Regulation, or whether envisaged action in relation to the controller or processor complies with this Regulation, which clearly demonstrates the significance of the risks posed by the draft decision as regards the fundamental rights and freedoms of data subjects and, where applicable, the free flow of personal data within the Union;

nodes.label: Point 25: ‘information society service’ means a service as defined in

attrs.text: ‘information society service’ means a service as defined in point (b) of Article 1(1) of Directive (EU) 2015/1535 of the European Parliament and of the Council (19);

nodes.label: Point 26: ‘international organisation’ means an organisation and its s

attrs.text: ‘international organisation’ means an organisation and its subordinate bodies governed by public international law, or any other body which is set up by, or on the basis of, an agreement between two or more countries.

nodes.label: Chapter II: Principles
Article 5: Principles relating to processing of personal data

attrs.title: Principles relating to processing of personal data

nodes.label: Point 1: Personal data shall be:

attrs.text: Personal data shall be:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner in re

attrs.text: processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner in relation to the data subject (‘lawfulness, fairness and transparency’);

nodes.label: Subpoint b: collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes an

attrs.text: collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes and not further processed in a manner that is incompatible with those purposes; further processing for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes shall, in accordance with Article 89(1), not be considered to be incompatible with the initial purposes (‘purpose limitation’);

nodes.label: Subpoint c: adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary in relat

attrs.text: adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary in relation to the purposes for which they are processed (‘data minimisation’);

nodes.label: Subpoint d: accurate and, where necessary, kept up to date; every reason

attrs.text: accurate and, where necessary, kept up to date; every reasonable step must be taken to ensure that personal data that are inaccurate, having regard to the purposes for which they are processed, are erased or rectified without delay (‘accuracy’);

nodes.label: Subpoint e: kept in a form which permits identification of data subjects

attrs.text: kept in a form which permits identification of data subjects for no longer than is necessary for the purposes for which the personal data are processed; personal data may be stored for longer periods insofar as the personal data will be processed solely for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes in accordance with Article 89(1) subject to implementation of the appropriate technical and organisational measures required by this Regulation in order to safeguard the rights and freedoms of the data subject (‘storage limitation’);

nodes.label: Subpoint f: processed in a manner that ensures appropriate security of t

attrs.text: processed in a manner that ensures appropriate security of the personal data, including protection against unauthorised or unlawful processing and against accidental loss, destruction or damage, using appropriate technical or organisational measures (‘integrity and confidentiality’).

nodes.label: Point 2: The controller shall be responsible for, and be able to demo

attrs.text: The controller shall be responsible for, and be able to demonstrate compliance with, paragraph 1 (‘accountability’).

nodes.label: Article 6: Lawfulness of processing
Point 1: Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at

attrs.text: Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: the data subject has given consent to the processing of his

attrs.text: the data subject has given consent to the processing of his or her personal data for one or more specific purposes;

nodes.label: Subpoint b: processing is necessary for the performance of a contract to

attrs.text: processing is necessary for the performance of a contract to which the data subject is party or in order to take steps at the request of the data subject prior to entering into a contract;

nodes.label: Subpoint c: processing is necessary for compliance with a legal obligati

attrs.text: processing is necessary for compliance with a legal obligation to which the controller is subject;

nodes.label: Subpoint d: processing is necessary in order to protect the vital intere

attrs.text: processing is necessary in order to protect the vital interests of the data subject or of another natural person;

nodes.label: Subpoint e: processing is necessary for the performance of a task carrie

attrs.text: processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller;

nodes.label: Subpoint f: processing is necessary for the purposes of the legitimate i

attrs.text: processing is necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the controller or by a third party, except where such interests are overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the data subject which require protection of personal data, in particular where the data subject is a child.

nodes.label: Text: Point (f) of the first subparagraph shall not apply to proce

attrs.text: Point (f) of the first subparagraph shall not apply to processing carried out by public authorities in the performance of their tasks.

nodes.label: Point 2: Member States may maintain or introduce more specific provis

attrs.text: Member States may maintain or introduce more specific provisions to adapt the application of the rules of this Regulation with regard to processing for compliance with points (c) and (e) of paragraph 1 by determining more precisely specific requirements for the processing and other measures to ensure lawful and fair processing including for other specific processing situations as provided for in Chapter IX.

nodes.label: Point 3: The basis for the processing referred to in point (c) and (e

attrs.text: The basis for the processing referred to in point (c) and (e) of paragraph 1 shall be laid down by:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: Union law; or

attrs.text: Union law; or

nodes.label: Subpoint b: Member State law to which the controller is subject.

attrs.text: Member State law to which the controller is subject.

nodes.label: Text: The purpose of the processing shall be determined in that le

attrs.text: The purpose of the processing shall be determined in that legal basis or, as regards the processing referred to in point (e) of paragraph 1, shall be necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller. That legal basis may contain specific provisions to adapt the application of rules of this Regulation, inter alia: the general conditions governing the lawfulness of processing by the controller; the types of data which are subject to the processing; the data subjects concerned; the entities to, and the purposes for which, the personal data may be disclosed; the purpose limitation; storage periods; and processing operations and processing procedures, including measures to ensure lawful and fair processing such as those for other specific processing situations as provided for in Chapter IX. The Union or the Member State law shall meet an objective of public interest and be proportionate to the legitimate aim pursued.

nodes.label: Point 4: Where the processing for a purpose other than that for which

attrs.text: Where the processing for a purpose other than that for which the personal data have been collected is not based on the data subject's consent or on a Union or Member State law which constitutes a necessary and proportionate measure in a democratic society to safeguard the objectives referred to in Article 23(1), the controller shall, in order to ascertain whether processing for another purpose is compatible with the purpose for which the personal data are initially collected, take into account, inter alia:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: any link between the purposes for which the personal data ha

attrs.text: any link between the purposes for which the personal data have been collected and the purposes of the intended further processing;

nodes.label: Subpoint b: the context in which the personal data have been collected,

attrs.text: the context in which the personal data have been collected, in particular regarding the relationship between data subjects and the controller;

nodes.label: Subpoint c: the nature of the personal data, in particular whether speci

attrs.text: the nature of the personal data, in particular whether special categories of personal data are processed, pursuant to Article 9, or whether personal data related to criminal convictions and offences are processed, pursuant to Article 10;

nodes.label: Subpoint d: the possible consequences of the intended further processing

attrs.text: the possible consequences of the intended further processing for data subjects;

nodes.label: Subpoint e: the existence of appropriate safeguards, which may include e

attrs.text: the existence of appropriate safeguards, which may include encryption or pseudonymisation.

nodes.label: Article 7: Conditions for consent
Point 1: Where processing is based on consent, the controller shall b

attrs.text: Where processing is based on consent, the controller shall be able to demonstrate that the data subject has consented to processing of his or her personal data.

nodes.label: Point 2: If the data subject's consent is given in the context of a w

attrs.text: If the data subject's consent is given in the context of a written declaration which also concerns other matters, the request for consent shall be presented in a manner which is clearly distinguishable from the other matters, in an intelligible and easily accessible form, using clear and plain language. Any part of such a declaration which constitutes an infringement of this Regulation shall not be binding.

nodes.label: Point 3: The data subject shall have the right to withdraw his or her

attrs.text: The data subject shall have the right to withdraw his or her consent at any time. The withdrawal of consent shall not affect the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal. Prior to giving consent, the data subject shall be informed thereof. It shall be as easy to withdraw as to give consent.

nodes.label: Point 4: When assessing whether consent is freely given, utmost accou

attrs.text: When assessing whether consent is freely given, utmost account shall be taken of whether, inter alia, the performance of a contract, including the provision of a service, is conditional on consent to the processing of personal data that is not necessary for the performance of that contract.

nodes.label: Article 8: Conditions applicable to child's consent in relation to info

attrs.title: Conditions applicable to child's consent in relation to information society services

nodes.label: Point 1: Where point (a) of Article 6(1) applies, in relation to the

attrs.text: Where point (a) of Article 6(1) applies, in relation to the offer of information society services directly to a child, the processing of the personal data of a child shall be lawful where the child is at least 16 years old. Where the child is below the age of 16 years, such processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that consent is given or authorised by the holder of parental responsibility over the child.

nodes.label: Text: Member States may provide by law for a lower age for those p

attrs.text: Member States may provide by law for a lower age for those purposes provided that such lower age is not below 13 years.

nodes.label: Point 2: The controller shall make reasonable efforts to verify in su

attrs.text: The controller shall make reasonable efforts to verify in such cases that consent is given or authorised by the holder of parental responsibility over the child, taking into consideration available technology.

nodes.label: Point 3: Paragraph 1 shall not affect the general contract law of Mem

attrs.text: Paragraph 1 shall not affect the general contract law of Member States such as the rules on the validity, formation or effect of a contract in relation to a child.

nodes.label: Article 9: Processing of special categories of personal data

attrs.title: Processing of special categories of personal data

nodes.label: Point 1: Processing of personal data revealing racial or ethnic origi

attrs.text: Processing of personal data revealing racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religious or philosophical beliefs, or trade union membership, and the processing of genetic data, biometric data for the purpose of uniquely identifying a natural person, data concerning health or data concerning a natural person's sex life or sexual orientation shall be prohibited.

nodes.label: Point 2: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if one of the following applies:

attrs.text: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if one of the following applies:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: the data subject has given explicit consent to the processin

attrs.text: the data subject has given explicit consent to the processing of those personal data for one or more specified purposes, except where Union or Member State law provide that the prohibition referred to in paragraph 1 may not be lifted by the data subject;

nodes.label: Subpoint b: processing is necessary for the purposes of carrying out the

attrs.text: processing is necessary for the purposes of carrying out the obligations and exercising specific rights of the controller or of the data subject in the field of employment and social security and social protection law in so far as it is authorised by Union or Member State law or a collective agreement pursuant to Member State law providing for appropriate safeguards for the fundamental rights and the interests of the data subject;

nodes.label: Subpoint c: processing is necessary to protect the vital interests of th

attrs.text: processing is necessary to protect the vital interests of the data subject or of another natural person where the data subject is physically or legally incapable of giving consent;

nodes.label: Subpoint d: processing is carried out in the course of its legitimate ac

attrs.text: processing is carried out in the course of its legitimate activities with appropriate safeguards by a foundation, association or any other not-for-profit body with a political, philosophical, religious or trade union aim and on condition that the processing relates solely to the members or to former members of the body or to persons who have regular contact with it in connection with its purposes and that the personal data are not disclosed outside that body without the consent of the data subjects;

nodes.label: Subpoint e: processing relates to personal data which are manifestly mad

attrs.text: processing relates to personal data which are manifestly made public by the data subject;

nodes.label: Subpoint f: processing is necessary for the establishment, exercise or d

attrs.text: processing is necessary for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims or whenever courts are acting in their judicial capacity;

nodes.label: Subpoint g: processing is necessary for reasons of substantial public in

attrs.text: processing is necessary for reasons of substantial public interest, on the basis of Union or Member State law which shall be proportionate to the aim pursued, respect the essence of the right to data protection and provide for suitable and specific measures to safeguard the fundamental rights and the interests of the data subject;

nodes.label: Subpoint h: processing is necessary for the purposes of preventive or oc

attrs.text: processing is necessary for the purposes of preventive or occupational medicine, for the assessment of the working capacity of the employee, medical diagnosis, the provision of health or social care or treatment or the management of health or social care systems and services on the basis of Union or Member State law or pursuant to contract with a health professional and subject to the conditions and safeguards referred to in paragraph 3;

nodes.label: Subpoint i: processing is necessary for reasons of public interest in th

attrs.text: processing is necessary for reasons of public interest in the area of public health, such as protecting against serious cross-border threats to health or ensuring high standards of quality and safety of health care and of medicinal products or medical devices, on the basis of Union or Member State law which provides for suitable and specific measures to safeguard the rights and freedoms of the data subject, in particular professional secrecy;

nodes.label: Subpoint j: processing is necessary for archiving purposes in the public

attrs.text: processing is necessary for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes in accordance with Article 89(1) based on Union or Member State law which shall be proportionate to the aim pursued, respect the essence of the right to data protection and provide for suitable and specific measures to safeguard the fundamental rights and the interests of the data subject.

nodes.label: Point 3: Personal data referred to in paragraph 1 may be processed fo

attrs.text: Personal data referred to in paragraph 1 may be processed for the purposes referred to in point (h) of paragraph 2 when those data are processed by or under the responsibility of a professional subject to the obligation of professional secrecy under Union or Member State law or rules established by national competent bodies or by another person also subject to an obligation of secrecy under Union or Member State law or rules established by national competent bodies.

nodes.label: Point 4: Member States may maintain or introduce further conditions,

attrs.text: Member States may maintain or introduce further conditions, including limitations, with regard to the processing of genetic data, biometric data or data concerning health.

nodes.label: Article 10: Processing of personal data relating to criminal convictions

attrs.title: Processing of personal data relating to criminal convictions and offences

nodes.label: Text: Processing of personal data relating to criminal convictions

attrs.text: Processing of personal data relating to criminal convictions and offences or related security measures based on Article 6(1) shall be carried out only under the control of official authority or when the processing is authorised by Union or Member State law providing for appropriate safeguards for the rights and freedoms of data subjects. Any comprehensive register of criminal convictions shall be kept only under the control of official authority.

nodes.label: Article 11: Processing which does not require identification

attrs.title: Processing which does not require identification

nodes.label: Point 1: If the purposes for which a controller processes personal da

attrs.text: If the purposes for which a controller processes personal data do not or do no longer require the identification of a data subject by the controller, the controller shall not be obliged to maintain, acquire or process additional information in order to identify the data subject for the sole purpose of complying with this Regulation.

nodes.label: Point 2: Where, in cases referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article,

attrs.text: Where, in cases referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article, the controller is able to demonstrate that it is not in a position to identify the data subject, the controller shall inform the data subject accordingly, if possible. In such cases, Articles 15 to 20 shall not apply except where the data subject, for the purpose of exercising his or her rights under those articles, provides additional information enabling his or her identification.

nodes.label: Chapter III: Rights of the data subject
Section 1: Transparency and modalities
Article 12: Transparent information, communication and modalities for th

attrs.title: Transparent information, communication and modalities for the exercise of the rights of the data subject

nodes.label: Point 1: The controller shall take appropriate measures to provide an

attrs.text: The controller shall take appropriate measures to provide any information referred to in Articles 13 and 14 and any communication under Articles 15 to 22 and 34 relating to processing to the data subject in a concise, transparent, intelligible and easily accessible form, using clear and plain language, in particular for any information addressed specifically to a child. The information shall be provided in writing, or by other means, including, where appropriate, by electronic means. When requested by the data subject, the information may be provided orally, provided that the identity of the data subject is proven by other means.

nodes.label: Point 2: The controller shall facilitate the exercise of data subject

attrs.text: The controller shall facilitate the exercise of data subject rights under Articles 15 to 22. In the cases referred to in Article 11(2), the controller shall not refuse to act on the request of the data subject for exercising his or her rights under Articles 15 to 22, unless the controller demonstrates that it is not in a position to identify the data subject.

nodes.label: Point 3: The controller shall provide information on action taken on

attrs.text: The controller shall provide information on action taken on a request under Articles 15 to 22 to the data subject without undue delay and in any event within one month of receipt of the request. That period may be extended by two further months where necessary, taking into account the complexity and number of the requests. The controller shall inform the data subject of any such extension within one month of receipt of the request, together with the reasons for the delay. Where the data subject makes the request by electronic form means, the information shall be provided by electronic means where possible, unless otherwise requested by the data subject.

nodes.label: Point 4: If the controller does not take action on the request of the

attrs.text: If the controller does not take action on the request of the data subject, the controller shall inform the data subject without delay and at the latest within one month of receipt of the request of the reasons for not taking action and on the possibility of lodging a complaint with a supervisory authority and seeking a judicial remedy.

nodes.label: Point 5: Information provided under Articles 13 and 14 and any commun

attrs.text: Information provided under Articles 13 and 14 and any communication and any actions taken under Articles 15 to 22 and 34 shall be provided free of charge. Where requests from a data subject are manifestly unfounded or excessive, in particular because of their repetitive character, the controller may either:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: charge a reasonable fee taking into account the administrati

attrs.text: charge a reasonable fee taking into account the administrative costs of providing the information or communication or taking the action requested; or

nodes.label: Subpoint b: refuse to act on the request.

attrs.text: refuse to act on the request.

nodes.label: Text: The controller shall bear the burden of demonstrating the ma

attrs.text: The controller shall bear the burden of demonstrating the manifestly unfounded or excessive character of the request.

nodes.label: Point 6: Without prejudice to Article 11, where the controller has re

attrs.text: Without prejudice to Article 11, where the controller has reasonable doubts concerning the identity of the natural person making the request referred to in Articles 15 to 21, the controller may request the provision of additional information necessary to confirm the identity of the data subject.

nodes.label: Point 7: The information to be provided to data subjects pursuant to

attrs.text: The information to be provided to data subjects pursuant to Articles 13 and 14 may be provided in combination with standardised icons in order to give in an easily visible, intelligible and clearly legible manner a meaningful overview of the intended processing. Where the icons are presented electronically they shall be machine-readable.

nodes.label: Point 8: The Commission shall be empowered to adopt delegated acts in

attrs.text: The Commission shall be empowered to adopt delegated acts in accordance with Article 92 for the purpose of determining the information to be presented by the icons and the procedures for providing standardised icons.

nodes.label: Section 2: Information and access to personal data

attrs.title: Information and access to personal data

nodes.label: Article 13: Information to be provided where personal data are collected

attrs.title: Information to be provided where personal data are collected from the data subject

nodes.label: Point 1: Where personal data relating to a data subject are collected

attrs.text: Where personal data relating to a data subject are collected from the data subject, the controller shall, at the time when personal data are obtained, provide the data subject with all of the following information:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: the identity and the contact details of the controller and,

attrs.text: the identity and the contact details of the controller and, where applicable, of the controller's representative;

nodes.label: Subpoint b: the contact details of the data protection officer, where ap

attrs.text: the contact details of the data protection officer, where applicable;

nodes.label: Subpoint c: the purposes of the processing for which the personal data a

attrs.text: the purposes of the processing for which the personal data are intended as well as the legal basis for the processing;

nodes.label: Subpoint d: where the processing is based on point (f) of Article 6(1),

attrs.text: where the processing is based on point (f) of Article 6(1), the legitimate interests pursued by the controller or by a third party;

nodes.label: Subpoint e: the recipients or categories of recipients of the personal d

attrs.text: the recipients or categories of recipients of the personal data, if any;

nodes.label: Subpoint f: where applicable, the fact that the controller intends to tr

attrs.text: where applicable, the fact that the controller intends to transfer personal data to a third country or international organisation and the existence or absence of an adequacy decision by the Commission, or in the case of transfers referred to in Article 46 or 47, or the second subparagraph of Article 49(1), reference to the appropriate or suitable safeguards and the means by which to obtain a copy of them or where they have been made available.

nodes.label: Point 2: In addition to the information referred to in paragraph 1, t

attrs.text: In addition to the information referred to in paragraph 1, the controller shall, at the time when personal data are obtained, provide the data subject with the following further information necessary to ensure fair and transparent processing:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: the period for which the personal data will be stored, or if

attrs.text: the period for which the personal data will be stored, or if that is not possible, the criteria used to determine that period;

nodes.label: Subpoint b: the existence of the right to request from the controller ac

attrs.text: the existence of the right to request from the controller access to and rectification or erasure of personal data or restriction of processing concerning the data subject or to object to processing as well as the right to data portability;

nodes.label: Subpoint c: where the processing is based on point (a) of Article 6(1) o

attrs.text: where the processing is based on point (a) of Article 6(1) or point (a) of Article 9(2), the existence of the right to withdraw consent at any time, without affecting the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal;

nodes.label: Subpoint d: the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority;

attrs.text: the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority;

nodes.label: Subpoint e: whether the provision of personal data is a statutory or con

attrs.text: whether the provision of personal data is a statutory or contractual requirement, or a requirement necessary to enter into a contract, as well as whether the data subject is obliged to provide the personal data and of the possible consequences of failure to provide such data;

nodes.label: Subpoint f: the existence of automated decision-making, including profil

attrs.text: the existence of automated decision-making, including profiling, referred to in Article 22(1) and (4) and, at least in those cases, meaningful information about the logic involved, as well as the significance and the envisaged consequences of such processing for the data subject.

nodes.label: Point 3: Where the controller intends to further process the personal

attrs.text: Where the controller intends to further process the personal data for a purpose other than that for which the personal data were collected, the controller shall provide the data subject prior to that further processing with information on that other purpose and with any relevant further information as referred to in paragraph 2.

nodes.label: Point 4: Paragraphs 1, 2 and 3 shall not apply where and insofar as t

attrs.text: Paragraphs 1, 2 and 3 shall not apply where and insofar as the data subject already has the information.

nodes.label: Article 14: Information to be provided where personal data have not been

attrs.title: Information to be provided where personal data have not been obtained from the data subject

nodes.label: Point 1: Where personal data have not been obtained from the data sub

attrs.text: Where personal data have not been obtained from the data subject, the controller shall provide the data subject with the following information:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: the identity and the contact details of the controller and,

attrs.text: the identity and the contact details of the controller and, where applicable, of the controller's representative;

nodes.label: Subpoint b: the contact details of the data protection officer, where ap

attrs.text: the contact details of the data protection officer, where applicable;

nodes.label: Subpoint c: the purposes of the processing for which the personal data a

attrs.text: the purposes of the processing for which the personal data are intended as well as the legal basis for the processing;

nodes.label: Subpoint d: the categories of personal data concerned;

attrs.text: the categories of personal data concerned;

nodes.label: Subpoint e: the recipients or categories of recipients of the personal d

attrs.text: the recipients or categories of recipients of the personal data, if any;

nodes.label: Subpoint f: where applicable, that the controller intends to transfer pe

attrs.text: where applicable, that the controller intends to transfer personal data to a recipient in a third country or international organisation and the existence or absence of an adequacy decision by the Commission, or in the case of transfers referred to in Article 46 or 47, or the second subparagraph of Article 49(1), reference to the appropriate or suitable safeguards and the means to obtain a copy of them or where they have been made available.

nodes.label: Point 2: In addition to the information referred to in paragraph 1, t

attrs.text: In addition to the information referred to in paragraph 1, the controller shall provide the data subject with the following information necessary to ensure fair and transparent processing in respect of the data subject:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: the period for which the personal data will be stored, or if

attrs.text: the period for which the personal data will be stored, or if that is not possible, the criteria used to determine that period;

nodes.label: Subpoint b: where the processing is based on point (f) of Article 6(1),

attrs.text: where the processing is based on point (f) of Article 6(1), the legitimate interests pursued by the controller or by a third party;

nodes.label: Subpoint c: the existence of the right to request from the controller ac

attrs.text: the existence of the right to request from the controller access to and rectification or erasure of personal data or restriction of processing concerning the data subject and to object to processing as well as the right to data portability;

nodes.label: Subpoint d: where processing is based on point (a) of Article 6(1) or po

attrs.text: where processing is based on point (a) of Article 6(1) or point (a) of Article 9(2), the existence of the right to withdraw consent at any time, without affecting the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal;

nodes.label: Subpoint e: the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority;

attrs.text: the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority;

nodes.label: Subpoint f: from which source the personal data originate, and if applic

attrs.text: from which source the personal data originate, and if applicable, whether it came from publicly accessible sources;

nodes.label: Subpoint g: the existence of automated decision-making, including profil

attrs.text: the existence of automated decision-making, including profiling, referred to in Article 22(1) and (4) and, at least in those cases, meaningful information about the logic involved, as well as the significance and the envisaged consequences of such processing for the data subject.

nodes.label: Point 3: The controller shall provide the information referred to in

attrs.text: The controller shall provide the information referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: within a reasonable period after obtaining the personal data

attrs.text: within a reasonable period after obtaining the personal data, but at the latest within one month, having regard to the specific circumstances in which the personal data are processed;

nodes.label: Subpoint b: if the personal data are to be used for communication with t

attrs.text: if the personal data are to be used for communication with the data subject, at the latest at the time of the first communication to that data subject; or

nodes.label: Subpoint c: if a disclosure to another recipient is envisaged, at the la

attrs.text: if a disclosure to another recipient is envisaged, at the latest when the personal data are first disclosed.

nodes.label: Point 4: Where the controller intends to further process the personal

attrs.text: Where the controller intends to further process the personal data for a purpose other than that for which the personal data were obtained, the controller shall provide the data subject prior to that further processing with information on that other purpose and with any relevant further information as referred to in paragraph 2.

nodes.label: Point 5: Paragraphs 1 to 4 shall not apply where and insofar as:

attrs.text: Paragraphs 1 to 4 shall not apply where and insofar as:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: the data subject already has the information;

attrs.text: the data subject already has the information;

nodes.label: Subpoint b: the provision of such information proves impossible or would

attrs.text: the provision of such information proves impossible or would involve a disproportionate effort, in particular for processing for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes, subject to the conditions and safeguards referred to in Article 89(1) or in so far as the obligation referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article is likely to render impossible or seriously impair the achievement of the objectives of that processing. In such cases the controller shall take appropriate measures to protect the data subject's rights and freedoms and legitimate interests, including making the information publicly available;

nodes.label: Subpoint c: obtaining or disclosure is expressly laid down by Union or M

attrs.text: obtaining or disclosure is expressly laid down by Union or Member State law to which the controller is subject and which provides appropriate measures to protect the data subject's legitimate interests; or

nodes.label: Subpoint d: where the personal data must remain confidential subject to

attrs.text: where the personal data must remain confidential subject to an obligation of professional secrecy regulated by Union or Member State law, including a statutory obligation of secrecy.

nodes.label: Article 15: Right of access by the data subject

attrs.title: Right of access by the data subject

nodes.label: Point 1: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the con

attrs.text: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller confirmation as to whether or not personal data concerning him or her are being processed, and, where that is the case, access to the personal data and the following information:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: the purposes of the processing;

attrs.text: the purposes of the processing;

nodes.label: Subpoint b: the categories of personal data concerned;

attrs.text: the categories of personal data concerned;

nodes.label: Subpoint c: the recipients or categories of recipient to whom the person

attrs.text: the recipients or categories of recipient to whom the personal data have been or will be disclosed, in particular recipients in third countries or international organisations;

nodes.label: Subpoint d: where possible, the envisaged period for which the personal

attrs.text: where possible, the envisaged period for which the personal data will be stored, or, if not possible, the criteria used to determine that period;

nodes.label: Subpoint e: the existence of the right to request from the controller re

attrs.text: the existence of the right to request from the controller rectification or erasure of personal data or restriction of processing of personal data concerning the data subject or to object to such processing;

nodes.label: Subpoint f: the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority;

attrs.text: the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority;

nodes.label: Subpoint g: where the personal data are not collected from the data subj

attrs.text: where the personal data are not collected from the data subject, any available information as to their source;

nodes.label: Subpoint h: the existence of automated decision-making, including profil

attrs.text: the existence of automated decision-making, including profiling, referred to in Article 22(1) and (4) and, at least in those cases, meaningful information about the logic involved, as well as the significance and the envisaged consequences of such processing for the data subject.

nodes.label: Point 2: Where personal data are transferred to a third country or to

attrs.text: Where personal data are transferred to a third country or to an international organisation, the data subject shall have the right to be informed of the appropriate safeguards pursuant to Article 46 relating to the transfer.

nodes.label: Point 3: The controller shall provide a copy of the personal data und

attrs.text: The controller shall provide a copy of the personal data undergoing processing. For any further copies requested by the data subject, the controller may charge a reasonable fee based on administrative costs. Where the data subject makes the request by electronic means, and unless otherwise requested by the data subject, the information shall be provided in a commonly used electronic form.

nodes.label: Point 4: The right to obtain a copy referred to in paragraph 3 shall

attrs.text: The right to obtain a copy referred to in paragraph 3 shall not adversely affect the rights and freedoms of others.

nodes.label: Section 3: Rectification and erasure
Article 16: Right to rectification
Text: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the con

attrs.text: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller without undue delay the rectification of inaccurate personal data concerning him or her. Taking into account the purposes of the processing, the data subject shall have the right to have incomplete personal data completed, including by means of providing a supplementary statement.

nodes.label: Article 17: Right to erasure (‘right to be forgotten’)

attrs.title: Right to erasure (‘right to be forgotten’)

nodes.label: Point 1: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the con

attrs.text: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller the erasure of personal data concerning him or her without undue delay and the controller shall have the obligation to erase personal data without undue delay where one of the following grounds applies:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: the personal data are no longer necessary in relation to the

attrs.text: the personal data are no longer necessary in relation to the purposes for which they were collected or otherwise processed;

nodes.label: Subpoint b: the data subject withdraws consent on which the processing i

attrs.text: the data subject withdraws consent on which the processing is based according to point (a) of Article 6(1), or point (a) of Article 9(2), and where there is no other legal ground for the processing;

nodes.label: Subpoint c: the data subject objects to the processing pursuant to Artic

attrs.text: the data subject objects to the processing pursuant to Article 21(1) and there are no overriding legitimate grounds for the processing, or the data subject objects to the processing pursuant to Article 21(2);

nodes.label: Subpoint d: the personal data have been unlawfully processed;

attrs.text: the personal data have been unlawfully processed;

nodes.label: Subpoint e: the personal data have to be erased for compliance with a le

attrs.text: the personal data have to be erased for compliance with a legal obligation in Union or Member State law to which the controller is subject;

nodes.label: Subpoint f: the personal data have been collected in relation to the off

attrs.text: the personal data have been collected in relation to the offer of information society services referred to in Article 8(1).

nodes.label: Point 2: Where the controller has made the personal data public and i

attrs.text: Where the controller has made the personal data public and is obliged pursuant to paragraph 1 to erase the personal data, the controller, taking account of available technology and the cost of implementation, shall take reasonable steps, including technical measures, to inform controllers which are processing the personal data that the data subject has requested the erasure by such controllers of any links to, or copy or replication of, those personal data.

nodes.label: Point 3: Paragraphs 1 and 2 shall not apply to the extent that proces

attrs.text: Paragraphs 1 and 2 shall not apply to the extent that processing is necessary:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: for exercising the right of freedom of expression and inform

attrs.text: for exercising the right of freedom of expression and information;

nodes.label: Subpoint b: for compliance with a legal obligation which requires proces

attrs.text: for compliance with a legal obligation which requires processing by Union or Member State law to which the controller is subject or for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller;

nodes.label: Subpoint c: for reasons of public interest in the area of public health

attrs.text: for reasons of public interest in the area of public health in accordance with points (h) and (i) of Article 9(2) as well as Article 9(3);

nodes.label: Subpoint d: for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or

attrs.text: for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes in accordance with Article 89(1) in so far as the right referred to in paragraph 1 is likely to render impossible or seriously impair the achievement of the objectives of that processing; or

nodes.label: Subpoint e: for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims.

attrs.text: for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims.

nodes.label: Article 18: Right to restriction of processing
Point 1: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the con

attrs.text: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller restriction of processing where one of the following applies:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: the accuracy of the personal data is contested by the data s

attrs.text: the accuracy of the personal data is contested by the data subject, for a period enabling the controller to verify the accuracy of the personal data;

nodes.label: Subpoint b: the processing is unlawful and the data subject opposes the

attrs.text: the processing is unlawful and the data subject opposes the erasure of the personal data and requests the restriction of their use instead;

nodes.label: Subpoint c: the controller no longer needs the personal data for the pur

attrs.text: the controller no longer needs the personal data for the purposes of the processing, but they are required by the data subject for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims;

nodes.label: Subpoint d: the data subject has objected to processing pursuant to Arti

attrs.text: the data subject has objected to processing pursuant to Article 21(1) pending the verification whether the legitimate grounds of the controller override those of the data subject.

nodes.label: Point 2: Where processing has been restricted under paragraph 1, such

attrs.text: Where processing has been restricted under paragraph 1, such personal data shall, with the exception of storage, only be processed with the data subject's consent or for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims or for the protection of the rights of another natural or legal person or for reasons of important public interest of the Union or of a Member State.

nodes.label: Point 3: A data subject who has obtained restriction of processing pu

attrs.text: A data subject who has obtained restriction of processing pursuant to paragraph 1 shall be informed by the controller before the restriction of processing is lifted.

nodes.label: Article 19: Notification obligation regarding rectification or erasure o

attrs.title: Notification obligation regarding rectification or erasure of personal data or restriction of processing

nodes.label: Text: The controller shall communicate any rectification or erasur

attrs.text: The controller shall communicate any rectification or erasure of personal data or restriction of processing carried out in accordance with Article 16, Article 17(1) and Article 18 to each recipient to whom the personal data have been disclosed, unless this proves impossible or involves disproportionate effort. The controller shall inform the data subject about those recipients if the data subject requests it.

nodes.label: Article 20: Right to data portability
Point 1: The data subject shall have the right to receive the persona

attrs.text: The data subject shall have the right to receive the personal data concerning him or her, which he or she has provided to a controller, in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format and have the right to transmit those data to another controller without hindrance from the controller to which the personal data have been provided, where:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: the processing is based on consent pursuant to point (a) of

attrs.text: the processing is based on consent pursuant to point (a) of Article 6(1) or point (a) of Article 9(2) or on a contract pursuant to point (b) of Article 6(1); and

nodes.label: Subpoint b: the processing is carried out by automated means.

attrs.text: the processing is carried out by automated means.

nodes.label: Point 2: In exercising his or her right to data portability pursuant

attrs.text: In exercising his or her right to data portability pursuant to paragraph 1, the data subject shall have the right to have the personal data transmitted directly from one controller to another, where technically feasible.

nodes.label: Point 3: The exercise of the right referred to in paragraph 1 of this

attrs.text: The exercise of the right referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article shall be without prejudice to Article 17. That right shall not apply to processing necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller.

nodes.label: Point 4: The right referred to in paragraph 1 shall not adversely aff

attrs.text: The right referred to in paragraph 1 shall not adversely affect the rights and freedoms of others.

nodes.label: Section 4: Right to object and automated individual decision-making

attrs.title: Right to object and automated individual decision-making

nodes.label: Article 21: Right to object
Point 1: The data subject shall have the right to object, on grounds

attrs.text: The data subject shall have the right to object, on grounds relating to his or her particular situation, at any time to processing of personal data concerning him or her which is based on point (e) or (f) of Article 6(1), including profiling based on those provisions. The controller shall no longer process the personal data unless the controller demonstrates compelling legitimate grounds for the processing which override the interests, rights and freedoms of the data subject or for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims.

nodes.label: Point 2: Where personal data are processed for direct marketing purpo

attrs.text: Where personal data are processed for direct marketing purposes, the data subject shall have the right to object at any time to processing of personal data concerning him or her for such marketing, which includes profiling to the extent that it is related to such direct marketing.

nodes.label: Point 3: Where the data subject objects to processing for direct mark

attrs.text: Where the data subject objects to processing for direct marketing purposes, the personal data shall no longer be processed for such purposes.

nodes.label: Point 4: At the latest at the time of the first communication with th

attrs.text: At the latest at the time of the first communication with the data subject, the right referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 shall be explicitly brought to the attention of the data subject and shall be presented clearly and separately from any other information.

nodes.label: Point 5: In the context of the use of information society services, a

attrs.text: In the context of the use of information society services, and notwithstanding Directive 2002/58/EC, the data subject may exercise his or her right to object by automated means using technical specifications.

nodes.label: Point 6: Where personal data are processed for scientific or historic

attrs.text: Where personal data are processed for scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes pursuant to Article 89(1), the data subject, on grounds relating to his or her particular situation, shall have the right to object to processing of personal data concerning him or her, unless the processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out for reasons of public interest.

nodes.label: Article 22: Automated individual decision-making, including profiling
Point 1: The data subject shall have the right not to be subject to a

attrs.text: The data subject shall have the right not to be subject to a decision based solely on automated processing, including profiling, which produces legal effects concerning him or her or similarly significantly affects him or her.

nodes.label: Point 2: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if the decision:

attrs.text: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if the decision:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: is necessary for entering into, or performance of, a contrac

attrs.text: is necessary for entering into, or performance of, a contract between the data subject and a data controller;

nodes.label: Subpoint b: is authorised by Union or Member State law to which the cont

attrs.text: is authorised by Union or Member State law to which the controller is subject and which also lays down suitable measures to safeguard the data subject's rights and freedoms and legitimate interests; or

nodes.label: Subpoint c: is based on the data subject's explicit consent.

attrs.text: is based on the data subject's explicit consent.

nodes.label: Point 3: In the cases referred to in points (a) and (c) of paragraph

attrs.text: In the cases referred to in points (a) and (c) of paragraph 2, the data controller shall implement suitable measures to safeguard the data subject's rights and freedoms and legitimate interests, at least the right to obtain human intervention on the part of the controller, to express his or her point of view and to contest the decision.

nodes.label: Point 4: Decisions referred to in paragraph 2 shall not be based on s

attrs.text: Decisions referred to in paragraph 2 shall not be based on special categories of personal data referred to in Article 9(1), unless point (a) or (g) of Article 9(2) applies and suitable measures to safeguard the data subject's rights and freedoms and legitimate interests are in place.

nodes.label: Section 5: Restrictions
Article 23: Restrictions
Point 1: Union or Member State law to which the data controller or pr

attrs.text: Union or Member State law to which the data controller or processor is subject may restrict by way of a legislative measure the scope of the obligations and rights provided for in Articles 12 to 22 and Article 34, as well as Article 5 in so far as its provisions correspond to the rights and obligations provided for in Articles 12 to 22, when such a restriction respects the essence of the fundamental rights and freedoms and is a necessary and proportionate measure in a democratic society to safeguard:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: national security;

attrs.text: national security;

nodes.label: Subpoint b: defence;

attrs.text: defence;

nodes.label: Subpoint c: public security;

attrs.text: public security;

nodes.label: Subpoint d: the prevention, investigation, detection or prosecution of c

attrs.text: the prevention, investigation, detection or prosecution of criminal offences or the execution of criminal penalties, including the safeguarding against and the prevention of threats to public security;

nodes.label: Subpoint e: other important objectives of general public interest of the

attrs.text: other important objectives of general public interest of the Union or of a Member State, in particular an important economic or financial interest of the Union or of a Member State, including monetary, budgetary and taxation a matters, public health and social security;

nodes.label: Subpoint f: the protection of judicial independence and judicial proceed

attrs.text: the protection of judicial independence and judicial proceedings;

nodes.label: Subpoint g: the prevention, investigation, detection and prosecution of

attrs.text: the prevention, investigation, detection and prosecution of breaches of ethics for regulated professions;

nodes.label: Subpoint h: a monitoring, inspection or regulatory function connected, e

attrs.text: a monitoring, inspection or regulatory function connected, even occasionally, to the exercise of official authority in the cases referred to in points (a) to (e) and (g);

nodes.label: Subpoint i: the protection of the data subject or the rights and freedom

attrs.text: the protection of the data subject or the rights and freedoms of others;

nodes.label: Subpoint j: the enforcement of civil law claims.

attrs.text: the enforcement of civil law claims.

nodes.label: Point 2: In particular, any legislative measure referred to in paragr

attrs.text: In particular, any legislative measure referred to in paragraph 1 shall contain specific provisions at least, where relevant, as to:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: the purposes of the processing or categories of processing;

attrs.text: the purposes of the processing or categories of processing;

nodes.label: Subpoint b: the categories of personal data;

attrs.text: the categories of personal data;

nodes.label: Subpoint c: the scope of the restrictions introduced;

attrs.text: the scope of the restrictions introduced;

nodes.label: Subpoint d: the safeguards to prevent abuse or unlawful access or transf

attrs.text: the safeguards to prevent abuse or unlawful access or transfer;

nodes.label: Subpoint e: the specification of the controller or categories of control

attrs.text: the specification of the controller or categories of controllers;

nodes.label: Subpoint f: the storage periods and the applicable safeguards taking int

attrs.text: the storage periods and the applicable safeguards taking into account the nature, scope and purposes of the processing or categories of processing;

nodes.label: Subpoint g: the risks to the rights and freedoms of data subjects; and

attrs.text: the risks to the rights and freedoms of data subjects; and

nodes.label: Subpoint h: the right of data subjects to be informed about the restrict

attrs.text: the right of data subjects to be informed about the restriction, unless that may be prejudicial to the purpose of the restriction.

nodes.label: Chapter IV: Controller and processor
Section 1: General obligations
Article 24: Responsibility of the controller
Point 1: Taking into account the nature, scope, context and purposes

attrs.text: Taking into account the nature, scope, context and purposes of processing as well as the risks of varying likelihood and severity for the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure and to be able to demonstrate that processing is performed in accordance with this Regulation. Those measures shall be reviewed and updated where necessary.

nodes.label: Point 2: Where proportionate in relation to processing activities, th

attrs.text: Where proportionate in relation to processing activities, the measures referred to in paragraph 1 shall include the implementation of appropriate data protection policies by the controller.

nodes.label: Point 3: Adherence to approved codes of conduct as referred to in Art

attrs.text: Adherence to approved codes of conduct as referred to in Article 40 or approved certification mechanisms as referred to in Article 42 may be used as an element by which to demonstrate compliance with the obligations of the controller.

nodes.label: Article 25: Data protection by design and by default

attrs.title: Data protection by design and by default

nodes.label: Point 1: Taking into account the state of the art, the cost of implem

attrs.text: Taking into account the state of the art, the cost of implementation and the nature, scope, context and purposes of processing as well as the risks of varying likelihood and severity for rights and freedoms of natural persons posed by the processing, the controller shall, both at the time of the determination of the means for processing and at the time of the processing itself, implement appropriate technical and organisational measures, such as pseudonymisation, which are designed to implement data-protection principles, such as data minimisation, in an effective manner and to integrate the necessary safeguards into the processing in order to meet the requirements of this Regulation and protect the rights of data subjects.

nodes.label: Point 2: The controller shall implement appropriate technical and org

attrs.text: The controller shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures for ensuring that, by default, only personal data which are necessary for each specific purpose of the processing are processed. That obligation applies to the amount of personal data collected, the extent of their processing, the period of their storage and their accessibility. In particular, such measures shall ensure that by default personal data are not made accessible without the individual's intervention to an indefinite number of natural persons.

nodes.label: Point 3: An approved certification mechanism pursuant to Article 42 m

attrs.text: An approved certification mechanism pursuant to Article 42 may be used as an element to demonstrate compliance with the requirements set out in paragraphs 1 and 2 of this Article.

nodes.label: Article 26: Joint controllers
Point 1: Where two or more controllers jointly determine the purposes

attrs.text: Where two or more controllers jointly determine the purposes and means of processing, they shall be joint controllers. They shall in a transparent manner determine their respective responsibilities for compliance with the obligations under this Regulation, in particular as regards the exercising of the rights of the data subject and their respective duties to provide the information referred to in Articles 13 and 14, by means of an arrangement between them unless, and in so far as, the respective responsibilities of the controllers are determined by Union or Member State law to which the controllers are subject. The arrangement may designate a contact point for data subjects.

nodes.label: Point 2: The arrangement referred to in paragraph 1 shall duly reflec

attrs.text: The arrangement referred to in paragraph 1 shall duly reflect the respective roles and relationships of the joint controllers vis-à-vis the data subjects. The essence of the arrangement shall be made available to the data subject.

nodes.label: Point 3: Irrespective of the terms of the arrangement referred to in

attrs.text: Irrespective of the terms of the arrangement referred to in paragraph 1, the data subject may exercise his or her rights under this Regulation in respect of and against each of the controllers.

nodes.label: Article 27: Representatives of controllers or processors not established

attrs.title: Representatives of controllers or processors not established in the Union

nodes.label: Point 1: Where Article 3(2) applies, the controller or the processor

attrs.text: Where Article 3(2) applies, the controller or the processor shall designate in writing a representative in the Union.

nodes.label: Point 2: The obligation laid down in paragraph 1 of this Article shal

attrs.text: The obligation laid down in paragraph 1 of this Article shall not apply to:

nodes.label: Subpoint a: processing which is occasional, does not include, on a large

attrs.text: processing which is occasional, does not include, on a large scale, processing of special categories of data as referred to in Article 9(1) or processing of personal data relating to criminal convictions and offences referred to in Article 10, and is unlikely to result in a risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons, taking into account the nature, context, scope and purposes of the processing; or

nodes.label: Subpoint b: a public authority or body.

attrs.text: a public authority or body.

nodes.label: Point 3: The representative shall be established in one of the Member

attrs.text: The representative shall be established in one of the Member States where the data subjects, whose personal data are processed in relation to the offering of goods or services to them, or whose behaviour is monitored, are.

nodes.label: Point 4: The representative shall be mandated by the controller or pr

attrs.text: The representative shall be mandated by the controller or processor to be addressed in addition to or instead of the controller or the processor by, in particular, supervisory authorities and data subjects, on all issues related to processing, for the purposes of ensuring compliance with this Regulation.
